node.title: Man jailed for sharing child sexual exploitation material online
node.description: Customs uncovered 12,242 objectionable publications, including a collection of some of the worst child sexual abuse material known to law enforcement agencies globally.
node.content: ["A Waikato man has been jailed for seven years and three months for sharing child sexual exploitation material online.\u00a0", "The 58-year-old man was sentenced in the Hamilton District Court on Wednesday. He was also registered on the Child Sex Offender Register.\u00a0", "The man was convicted of importing, possessing, exporting and distributing child sexual exploitation material, along with refusing to allow Customs Officers access to search his devices.", "The defendant, who is from Huntington, uploaded child sexual exploitation material to his social media accounts in November 2020.", "He was also detected distributing child sexual exploitation material in January 2021, and was subsequently reported to law enforcement authorities by the social media platform he was using.", "\"We have an unwavering commitment to identifying and stopping sexual abusers of children, working closely with our partners in the police and Internal Affairs, as well as overseas agencies, to identify and hold to account those who exploit children in this heinous way,\" Simon Peterson Chief Customs Officer of the Child Exploitation Operations Team says.\u00a0", "The defendant was arrested in February after Customs investigated the reports and executed a search warrant.", "A cell phone and a number of other electronic devices were seized, and subsequent forensic examination uncovered 12,242 objectionable publications.", "Customs described the content as \"some of the worst child sexual abuse material known to law enforcement agencies globally\".\u00a0", "Any publication that promotes or supports the exploitation of children for sexual purposes is deemed an objectionable publication under the Films, Videos, and Publications Classification Act 1993. Objectionable publications are also prohibited imports and exports under the Customs and Excise Act 2018. The maximum penalty for the importation or exportation of objectionable publications is 10 years' imprisonment.", "Where to find help and support:\u00a0", "If you are, or know of, someone who is at risk or being abused, contact the Police immediately.\u00a0\u00a0"]
